availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George R. Page (Adair County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Mary Irvine Page in Adair County on December 14, 1837. Father of Mary J. Page, James T. Page, John J. Page, Lucy Page, Anne E. Page, William J. Page, Walter Page, and George Page. Resident of Adair County in 1850. Farmer in Adair County in 1860. Owned two enslaved individuals in Adair County in 1850. Owned four enslaved individuals in Adair County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 68A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, County, District 2, p. 27-28.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Division 2, p. 31.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Division 2, p. 4.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, p. 51B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, Film #000830575, p. 46.
Find A Grave, "George Robert Page (Dec 27, 1813-Jull 29, 1885)," Memorial #55448588, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/ 55448588 (accessed October 27, 2020).
